mods.note: DRAFT EXCHANGE OF LETTERS. \ V (copy) EXCHANGE OF LETTERS Draft letter from H. Consul. Muscat to the Sultan. With reference to the Heads of Agreement concerning aviation between His Majestyâ€™s Government in the United Kingdom and Your Highness, dated the 5th April, 1947, I have the honour to confirm the request made to Your Highness by the Royal Air Force Authorities in the course of discussions in August 1950 that no buildings or other obstructions shall be erected within 1500 yards from the ends of the runways at the aerodromes of Masirah and Salalah (that is to say, within the fly ing approaches to these aerodromes) without their consent. 2. I understand that in the course of the discussions men tioned, Your Highness expressed willingness to control in this manner the erection of buildings or obstructions in the areas mentioned, and I should now be grateful if you would convey to me in writing your formal consent to the Royal Air Force request. Draft Reply from the Sultan. With reference to your letter dated we are pleased to confirm our agreement that no buildings or other obstructions shall be erected within 1500 yards from the ends of the runways at the aerodromes of Masirah and Salalah without the consent of the Roy ad Air Force Authorities.

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in chronological order from the front to the rear of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 3; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains a draft exchange of letters between the British Consul at Muscat and the Sultan of Muscat and Oman related to the Muscat Civil Air Agreement of 1947.
